comments.text:
Verry good spot lots of cars.
Walked from the train station Hegyeshalom to here in about a hour - quite a long distance but made sense for us because we had the Hungary pass.
After 10minutes I got a ride to Nürnberg.
It was heavily raining and I was waiting at the rock with a Münich sign. It only took about 25-30 minutes before a guy from Kosovo offered me a ride to Germany and relatively close to Münich aswell!
Very easy spot. Asked around parked cars and found a couple who took me all the way to Salzburg almost immediately.

This is the BEST place when leaving Hungary towards Austria / Wien. Here you will see a huge rock next to the road, put your pack on it and try to hitchhike. All the trucks and cars are going back to the motorway here! If you want to get on to A1 motorway try to hitch with a LINZ sign, always worked! :]
Picked up immediately headed to Vienna with sign. Lots of traffic during the week lots of places to stop and very visible despite the cars moving fast.
Good spot for getting to the main highway south of linz - going either to salzburg or to wien - and you can change directions at the service station there.

We wanted to go to slovenia but most of the cars go westwards. There is not much traffic bit people are very nice. Many drivers stopped and asked us where we want to go but it was not our direction. Finally we decided to take a ride to a gas station on the highway that heads to slovenia eventough it was not the shortest way.
Got a ride to Slovenia pretty much immediately
We got a nice ride immediatly towards Graz
Good spot
good spot to go to graz
you can wait behind the roundabout, there i a small bay where cars can park. got a ride straight to maribor

Good spot also to go to schwechat.
Many cars!
wien - budapest, in 10 minutes i have got car to gas station which is on the way to budapest. and there directly to budapest also in 10 min.
It'a a nice place to hitchhike and ask people to grab you. There is hotel too. After 20 minutes we ended up going to Graz
Dir. Vienna, 20 min, ride to Vienna
Complicated system of onramps, for direction Vienna stay at the big roundabout or ask around
A Croatian guy picked me up, offered me a spare room where I could sleep and the next morning he drove me to a big gas station.
A lot of traffic, did take some time on a Saturday, but after a while, we found a lift to Passau. A lot of Austrian, Romanian and Hungarian cars.
good towards linz, passau, munich
Very good spot

Very Good Place to get to Switzerland.
Many swiss people buy stuff in austria because it's cheaper and go back to Switzerland. Got to St. Gallen within Minutes.
Amazing spot, catches the merging truck traffic and all northbound drivers to CZ. Was on my way to PRAHA in barely a minute
Great hidden gem. Many czech guys.

A couple with huge backpacks. First we waited on a gas station before the borders but it was a bit rush there and not many people seemed to react to us. After maybe 35 minutes a truck stopped and took us on a spot just before the borders. Then we walked to this gas station and now going to Wien after 15 minutes.. I recommend to cross the borders, its easier then.
The best spot at the border to get to Vienna and beyond! For the other direction to Czechia looks good too!

Best spot to get out of Imst, waited there during high traffic hours around 17:00 and there was a ton of cars commuting home for the day. We wanted to get to Italy from there but that was a long shot, two minutes after changing our sign to Landeck we got a ride there. There is a bus shelter and gas station and a place you can sit on by the road. Great spot.
Stay Just before Gas station. You can get a long ride in few minutes
was quite busy when I got here, had no problem getting a ride to graz
Cars see you. Has a place to safely stop and shadow from the building. also market across the road. easly got ride to Lienz
Got a ride to Lienz.
Truck drivers go long distances from here

Third time hitchhiking here and being picked up within 5 minutes (sign with "Bad Vöslau").

Friendly local drivers here, great for short trips <30km!

Almost too easy. Local hitchhiking (short distance village to village) is a piece of cake here.
Was picked up after less than a few minutes. People are hitchhiker-friendly in this area.

Summer 2025
Good spot to grab something to eat, big station. Didn't had to wait long. A person took us to St.Pölten, our goal for the day was Wien (which we later reached).
Two male travelers

just go along the road and ask around where most of the people are.
i decided to do something stupid and went to Vienna by foot, which took me 14 hours, but at this place you get a ride just by existing. cross the border.
got picked up instantly. ez to go to brno. wasn't very picky that day, but you can go directly to prague.
Good spot for direction vienna
Not exactly ideal spot, but there Is a bit od Space for Cars to stop. Quickest hitch of my life
Good Position for Vienna and St. Pölten /Linz. Man cars pass for the perfect ride.
Good Spot to get a fast ride out of Graz. My direction is Vienna and the kind driver picked me up After 2 minutes of waiting on a saturday miday.
Good spot, because many czech people stop there.

I saw a lot of bad reviews for the gas station. So i went to this traffic light and after 5 minutes somebody took me to Linz center. It is easier to hitchhike from the other side of Linz to go to Czech.
Great spot to hitchike to St. Pölten

Good spot to go to Vienna
Got picked up by the third car, got taken close to Vienna.
It's in a shade, cars have nice spot to stop and people are going to the direction of Vienna. Feels comfortable.
2 guys, backpackers
You have to ask around but it's a good spot. We were hitchhiking with two groups of two. Both had a ride within an hour.
If you stand on the roundabout with a sign to Innsbruck, the cars can take the exit onto the parking lot.
A lot of people going to croatia on vacation, but with already full cars. However many people are also going to Graz
Nice spot, with place for cars to stop, if it's not busy you can also try to hitch both cars from main road and the one from bellow on the opposite side. Got ride to Slovenia in 5min.
Waited infront of the bus stop on the curb with a sign and got a ride nearly immediately. Perfect for people to pull over and traffic isnt too fast

Waited for a ride towards Italy/Slowenia
got a ride with a cute family, it took longer to write a sign then to chatch a ride :)
Lots of traffic even in the evening, the one way road forces the cars from McDonald's to go around you slowly, so you have a big chance to get picked up.
Easy towards klagenfurt centre
put out a thumb out of desperation mid-hike cuz no one wanted to pick us up in Terz and got picked up
need I say more?
A bus stop with plenty enough room for cars to stop. usually driving short distances though
Good spot with a plenty space for cars to pull up (bus stop)
If you somehow end up here, you'll hitch an easy ride to st polten
if you somehow end up here, the spot is good towards a bigger town, but few cara going in direction St. Polten
Lots of cars passing very slowely, space to pull over, gas station in case you want to buy something or it is raining badly. Excellent spot to go either go to Wien or south, both are possible
Waited before the split between road 70 and 92. Cars moving fast but spot to pull over. Maybe better luck further down the road

Perfect spot to get a ride south or to Graz, it took me 45 minutes waiting. I had a sign with just GRAZ and on the flip side, SÜD. I tried asking around at the BP gas station just up the road for an hour and a half and most people were locals. I highly recommend this spot as it gives driver's time to see you and your sign, also there is some space for them to stop if they wanna pick you up, highly recommended! 👍
Nice

If you’re trying to get into Italy every car that passes is going the right direction. We waited 5 minutes with a sign for Malles Venosta Mals and got a ride straight there. Huge area for cars to pull out at the gas station.

The third car took me
The space to stop is the wrong side of the road but, makes it funny, and there is a lot of space, moreover cars are going slowly .
I was taken not far, but where i wanted to, and there, there is a petrol station to hichhack further if you want
Busy rest station with cars going both directions of A1 Autobahn. Asking people directly works well here.
Great spot to reach the Grossglockner scenic road. Room for the cars to stop, shade from the sun and pretty views.
a lot of cars heading southeast of austria.

Amazing Spot, especially if you’re trying to get to Linz. 
It‘s directly after a roundabout so cars are driving slow and can see you well. Many cars go towards Linz. I‘d recommend trying to get a ride directly to Linz as it might be hard to get another ride along the road.
I‘m hitchhiking to Linz quite a lot and people stop for me within 5-15 minutes usually.

The gas station in fernpass is the best spot for getting out of tirol to A7 in germany. you cna both hitch here with a thumb or ask people directly on the station. It is a good spot and i would recommend to stay here until you find a lift all the way to A7 (if thats where youre heading). THere is also a gas station in Reute but here it is better.
Good spot! I got picked up from the ramp
Perfect spot for hitchhiking. Many people going slow after the toll station and very likely they go a good distance
Lovely trucker picked us up. At this spot there are three different lanes that cars will come through prioritize the lane with truckers and cars coming off the highway.

Great spot, the road from maribor was all jammed up, so cars were leaving thru here. Weekend and a summer holiday so a lot of germans and austrians leaving home. Caught a pair from my city so going straight home!! (sign for vienna bcs dont want to get stuck in graz)
great place to hh north, waited 15min and got a ride to Linz (solo male backpacker)
perfect for the any place in b165
2 guys, catched a ride to the last big gas station before Italian border with a sign.
many people from slovakia go shopping here, so i got a ride to bratislava fairly quickly
Great place. It is above traffic light So Cars go slow. There is shadow afternoon where  you can stay.
Great place! Its behind the rondel, So Cars go Slow. I got stop before I Stand on the spot.

I guess I was lucky to get a ride with a second car, but still, very good spot. Free toilet at the gas station - ask for a key near the counter, McDonalds is also nearby. Needs more testing, but you can definitely try your luck here.
low traffic but nice people going to lj, dont worry about the cops they wont do anything
The bus station is a great place for the passing cars to slow down. Almost everyone goes to Italy from here and it should not be difficult to hitch a ride that goes there.
Easiest way to get on the highway south direction. Waited 5 minutes and got dropped off in a gas station on the road.
excellent spot! got a ride here to prague (and even to the main station🧚🏼)!
Got a ride in three minutes. Me and my sister, and we had a Maribor sign. Many local cars go this way.

Was good, we wanted to go to st Ankton am arlberg. A young man picked us up and brought us, very nice. It was unclear whether we needed to be on this side of the road or the other. But it worked quite quickly!
One of the first trucks that came by took us had a great ride. Excellent spot for going into the direction of Salzburg.
My last car got me to Gries. There was a steep walk to the gas station, but it was wort it. The second car I asked picked me up to Bolzano.
We were 2 Boys
I've gotten lucky at this spot twice and in both cases found straight rides to Munich. Not a lot of traffic, but the few cars that do stop seem to go far.
In the middle of nowhere, but I got picked up fast and got onto the Tauernschleuse train. Then you can literally hitchhike the train with the driver :)

Great spot to get a local ride to Baden, Bad Vöslau, St. Veit etc.

Use a sign and you will be picked up super fast!
There is no much time for drivers to decide but still wait only 20 minuts for pickup towards Bregenz.

Great spot, a lot of traffic going slow, Bavarians are very hitchhiker-friendly and in a good mood! Got picked up here 3 times, each time within 15 minutes. Choose a spot where drivers can stop without hindering the traffic behind.

A good spot, Like another hitchihker, I got out from one car and immediately got into another, heading to Vienna. That was at 21:30 so even at night you have a chance.

There's also a Burger King so you can warm up or get WiFi and charge your phone.

Good spot, make sure to stand next to the entrance lane of the gas station so both cars going into the gas station as well as cars passing it can see you. 
I got a ride to Vienna after less than 30 minutes.
Strangely enough, despite being located in a corner, you get a fast response here. Also, a truck company is right next to it, so you have a chance to ask truck drivers for a ride.

Very good spot for short distance to go to Berchtesgaden, Bad reichenhall, Lofer, Zell am See or Kitzbühel.
Cheap fuel so even at nighttime a lot of cars stop and you can ask drivers

This has to be one of the best hitchhiking spots in Tirol for both directions. Most of the cars passing here are coming from or going onto the highway. Got a ride to Innsbruck within 10 minutes and on the way back I was dropped off here and got a ride to St. Johann within 5 minutes. Fantastic place!

I tried this spot instead of ths roundabout, i got a lift to Maribor in 10 minutes with a SLO sign. Here its legal to hitchhike because you can stand before the highway sign, there are enough place for the cars to stop and they are not so fast. I think the best spot to hitchhike to Slovenia.
Good spot. Enough place for the cars, enough traffic. You can find a car to go to North.
Got a ride almost to Graz with a sign
Had a sign "Graz", got 55 km ride in that direction

Perfect for going to western Austria - we found a ride to our goal (Vorarlberg) almost immediately. In the first 2 minutes of waiting, we spotted three Vorarlberg plates and in the end a swiss guy who turned up minutes later took us straight to our home :)
I was disappointed because people misunderstood the concept of hitchhiking. Contemptuous attitude
Not many cars were stopping when I was there (8am on a weekday) but I got a ride to Linz in approx 20 mins. One of the best spots to get out of Vienna in this direction for sure !
The petrol station wasn't really busy when I was there (Monday, 8am), but still got a lift to Salzburg pretty soon (waited around 20 minutes). Would recommend this spot.
only waited five minutes for a ride to linz - good spot!

It's good to hitchhike near exit. Asking people on the parking lot is also fine, if you feel confident.
A lot of people going really far away stop here for McDonald's. 
Most of them were fully packed and didn't have much space in the car.
We were 2 guys with bags => needed half empty car.
There will be probably some truckers - again if you are confident, just ask.
Got ride in 15 min. I think there might have been less trafic because of construction but it was not  a problem.

It's a perfect spot to hitchhike, cars are going slowly. The part of the highway was under construction, so it was low traffic there. Maybe without the construction, there is better traffic and then higher chance to catch a ride. We ended up moving to the another gas station without construction place.
Awesome in direction to Graz/Maribor

Decent spot
Lower traffic (probably due to the cosntruction that is taking place there [1.7.2025])
A bit hard for i guy to stop. But i had luck since here was a construction sight.
good for going to Czech from Linz, write down Freistadt and your almost there
40 mins and we catch car to villach
First car that spotted me with the sign took me to Villach
20 minutes of waiting with the sign at 7A.M. Perfect spot

I believe this is the best place to stand, right after the curve and before the highway sign. Cars from both directions can see you. We showed a salzburg sign, but managed to get a best ride that I ever gotten. Swiss millionaire in a sports car taking us all the way to southern Switzerland! Probably very lucky, but still a good spot.
We got a ride to Salzburg in about 1 hour (we just waited and showed our sign).
A Little bit busy spot, there was a couple of other guys along the road :). Whe had luck by asking in the gas station, a girl took us to another gas station near Baden

Hhiking out of Vienna towards South (Wr. Neustadt, Graz, Klagenfurth, Villach)
Much traffic, but less people drive out of vienna. Hhiking with sign does not work very good. Just ask people at the gas station.
We needed ten minutes for getting a ride to the resting station at Wechsel.
We stood there on a saturday morning and got a lift quite easily towards St Marein
walk further down, you’ll be luckier there.
We went there at 8, sunday morning. Not even 5min later, we got a ride to the next rest area on A2 where we found another lift towards Graz.
noone stops if you have a sign. after 2 hours someone took me to the nearest gas station on the highway..and from there everything went smothly.. but its a good point teoretically

We were asking at the gas station but with no results so we moved to bus stop before the entrance to the station (with Graz sign) and tried to catch someone going south. There is plenty of space to stop a car and finally we got a ride to Wiener Neustadt gas station which is great place to find a ride to Graz.
Really nice spot. Two cars stopped for me in 5 minutes. Looks like a lot of cars are local tho. Got a 15min ride to Unterloibl Ort, from where it was easy to get ride to Slovenia.
With a sign saying SLO, we got a ride to a town close to Ljubljana in like 5mins. Plenty enough space for cars to see you, read the sign and stop
perfect spot for slovenia, austrians are nice in this part of the country

I was staying with a host in Klagenfurt who dropped me off near here, there are a couple gas stations and lots of place for cars to pull over safely (just walk up and down the road a bit to see the best place) - but almost all of the cars leaving on this road will be going to Slovenia (quite easy to get a lift all the way to Ljubljana). I got a lift fairly easily to Kranj where I was staying.

Good place to hitch-hike to Slovenia. There is bus stop there and Mc Donald on the opposite site of the street. A lot of cars is going this way but they are mostly going to nearby valleys, but to Slovenia also. This place has one important disadvantage! Way to Slovenia is going through mountains and sometimes is impassable because of snow or rocks on the road. You can reach this place by bus from train station as well as walk there.

Got a ride straight to Budapest from a Swiss man!
Although the station seems underwhelming it worked for us. Not much luck with Austrians, it seems like they aren't very hitchhiking friendly.
Not a lot of cars there but the second person I asked took me to Linz
Encountered nice and helpful drivers here. It's a small gas station so easy to ask and get a ride to Linz area, direction Vienna
late july 2011 ; a small petrol station after salzburg but steady flux of cars ; the kind where it's better to ask people...
A small petrol station, on the highway going East.

two cars stopped in one hour, both going to St Pölten, i refused the first and took the second, I had both luck and unluck on the next Autohof before St Pölten (in the end a ride from there to Germany), maybe it was a bad time of the day, cardrivers blinded by the sun and me standing in a shadow

Wouldn’t call it my fastest time yet to catch a car, but the spot seemed good. But nobody really stopped (Monday morning during November). But in the end somebody stopped and gave me a ride next to Linz
Easy to get here from the city, best spot in the region to West on A1. We got a ride straight to Salzburg. :) 2 persons (my girlfriend and me), Thursday, 1h10m
great spot. waited 2 minutes
Here was our fastest hitch-hiking. I just started to write sign LINZ - and in 20 seconds my friend stoped 2 cars!
A lot of local traffic but also people going to Germany - got a ride to the Ellwanger Berge station after an hour
Got a ride to the Austrian-German border, most of the cars were heading towards Switzerland though.
There is both gas station and a nice place to hold a sign or a thumb up for cars! Many German and Swiss cars go to Austria for shopping so it's pretty good for either one of those directions!
Very good spot, go on the ramp and use a cove by the road.
Place for cars to stop, moderate traffic. Got a ride to Linz after a while. Overall great spot

The spot is a bit behind the highway sign, but there's enough place to stop (there's no other good place). Two guys were hitchhiking and a car stopped after 5 mins taking to Salzburg. But I have to say that when the car stopped, my friend went to look for a shadow, so practically the Serbian driver stopped only for one guy..

Tried here and gave up, cars go fast and don't have so much space to stop, and most of them drive on the left lane. I had a sign for Innsbruck but it was probably too small for drivers to read it. I changed plans and went back to Feldkirch to hitch at the bus stop.

3 guys, 8PM weekday

We managed to get ride to Innsbruck in 5 minutes, seems to be good place, but maybe we were lucky.
Very good place. Caught a car to Innsbruck in 5 minutes (standing with a sign with "Innsbruck" name on it)
The best place to hitchike to Innsbruck. 2 cars stopped in 5 minutes.
Winter ride to Vienna middle of day during week not too much passage lots of foreign plate. Many rich Austrians who don't pick up good spot none the less
Lots of cars passing through for Vienna, worth standing at the grass to the left of the services where cars pull in or pass by from petrol station, everyone basically heading to Vienna
A lot of trucks to vienna, italy and Brno
Walked here from the Czech border. There may be a speed restriction present, so the passing cars go nice and slow around you. They have plenty of room to park.
for anywhere in czechia or poland, this is a spot for ambition!

gets all mcdonalds and reststop trafic that goes to A5.
pretty chill.
Ideal for vienna
Great spot, I recommend to go a little bit further towards highway on the ramp. There is good space for cars to stop. I had a sign "A11 SLO" and literally first car stopped and took me to Radovljica.
Got picked up almost instantly by a car with another hitchhiker
We stood at the exit thumbing because there was so much traffic at the gas station.
lot of trucks, and many ppl also if u tired there is a coffee machine
Got a ride to Innsbruck at 9:30. Some people take this road to avoid tolls. Many local drivers and tourists

Was easy, people had to go to Stuben from here and use this one instead of the big tunnel bc of construction. Was perfect to stand next to the road and people could stop quickly but I think they might have found that a bit complicated bc our ride stopped on the road directly.
Waited for ride to Salzburg with sign, didn’t have to wait long, the cars go quite slow here. There’s also a supermarket on the other side of the road
Bus stop after roundabout, cars go slow. Good for going to Salzburg.
perfect spot to bratislava
Got offered a ride to Maribor when walking to this point from the city center with a SLO sign sticked on my backpack. The guy told me there is several thousand Slovenians commuting to Graz everyday.

We are two guys, uno of us stood with a sign "Kalgenfurt" in the grass area in middle of the road before the roundabout, the other one was a bit further near the traffic lights, asking to the cars which stopped there. With this technique we found a ride in about 30 minutes. Before trying with this setup just one stood with a sign on the right side of the road for 1,5 hours, without success
We get a ride to breclav. Point is ok, cars can easly stop.
walked here from the train station. There’s a pullout for cars here, we held i sign for CR and someone stopped right away.
Last busy petrol station before Czechia. Nice spot, got a ride easily to Brno
Gas station, after around 45 minutes we got lift to Brno. Good place to hitchhike to Czech, Poland, Germany
Its good in direction to germany not that good in direction to Lienz. I had a sign "CZ" and got ride after 1 hour.
This hitchhiking point can only be reached from the highway, however it is good if you are traveling towards Linz or Munich.

Once again, it didn't take long to find a ride directly to Salzburg
(Wednesday morning)

From a strategical perspective, an excellent spot. All the traffic coming from Zell am See going to Salzburg or Munich has to pass this gas station. Gas station staff is friendly and welcoming to hitchhikers.

However, keep in mind that the long-distance travellers from Zell am See are mostly wealthy people (ski tourists) reluctant to pick up a poor hitchhiker.
Local traffic won't pick you up.

Be patient though, the statistics are in your favor and this place is almost a safe bet. You can

Very nice to go direction Munich/Salzburg.
You can reach the place via bus: Bus stop Volders Volderer Brücke.
Car Drive slow, Long Line of sight and place for parking. great spot
It looks great, I was just probably unlucky. Waited 1h20 and got a ride only to St Polten.

That's how the classic hitchhiking spot should look like - cars going slow, there is plenty of space to stop and you are visible from a far. I got there on Wednesday evening and got a ride to Andorf (small town in north Austria) with a driver who was going to Munich eventually.
Great spot towards Linz
Good spot
Ideal for going in direction villach

Was a little bit tricky in the rain. You can ask people on station, but there is also a lot of cars going around from McDonald's and parking directly to the exit. Due to bad weather some lady offered me a ride to next Raststation.
Very large reststop with a lot of cars. Asked around people with a Ljublijana sign and got a ride to Villach very quickly👍.

very good spot to get a ride to at least Villach, but if you're going to Slovenia it might be better to try and get a direct ride, as the last petrol station before Villach might be one of the most senseless gas stations in Europe.

Direction Villach.

Fairly good traffic, generally a good place to ask around or just stay put with a sign.

It was raining and already dark so I just stayed on the station and ask drivers. One guy took me straight to Villach. I saw a lot of cars with SLO plates. In good weather and daylight probably it's better to stand on the exit from the parking, there is a lot of truck drivers who are taking a break on these parkings.
Most cars are full to the brim, got a ride south though, really helpful people

I got a truck driver to Graz! After waiting 30 minutes, mainly with sign to Villach (i wasn't decided where to go) but I also had a Graz and Süd sign... Most cars went to Salzburg i feel like or closer than Villach, and didn't want to take... pretty good spot

My greatest hitch-hiking experience occurred here. Dropped off at the shell garage by an ambulance, and about an hour later hitched a ride in a car that was strapped onto the back of a Slovenian lorry and taken all the way to Villach.
I asked a couple on the gas station and they give me a ride straight to Budapest
I was here asking people entering the gast station. Got a lot of offers to Vienna and got a ride to Slovakia after 30 min
Good for Wienna direction
If you want to go in the direction of Vienna, it's easy going. The second person I asked took me with him! Good ride! Just keep looking for license plates saying "W"
Good to Wiena dir. But had bad luck to Freistadt / CZ dir.

perfect for rides to innsbruck (and prolly also other places in tyrol), catches rural traffic and cars going west from kufstein, waited so very not long, not rlly that much space to pull over but everyone going slow and great visibility and ppl will pull over
Also good for going south: I got a very good ride to Innsbruck in less than 15 minutes.
Not a lot of space, and most people seem to go south, but I got a northbound ride to Munich quickly
I agreed, not a lot of space, but I've been this is a best spot for going toward Germany.
Not a lot of space for people to stop, but it's the best in Kufstein.
Good enough if you're going towards Vienna. At night, there is not a lot of traffic at all, we were there around 10pm and it was dead
Wasn't lucky because of the rain but quite good spot on the roundabout. Not so crowded area on a afternoon weekday
We stood there with a sign for vienna. Cars go slow and notice you. Its a good spot.
Two girls, waited for just 4 minutes
The only way from Attersee to highway. Two guys waited here about 20 mins.
spot looks very unlikely, but got picked up very fast in the rain
best spot to leave Krems southwards to St. Poelten and the main austrian highways.
First car stopped and took me to Feldkirch.
Plenty of room for cars to stop, everyone can see you as they have to stop/slow down at the border. Got a lift to Feldkirck.
Took a little but got a ride all the way to the border
good for direction bolzano
I think its a good Spot and u can Catch Rides all the way to Switzerland. There are also a lot of Cars heading to Germany. It can Take some time.

Spent about half an hour here, a bit before the bus stop before someone stopped and took us to Bregenz. We had cardboard from before, but as they said on the stop opposite, you can probably get it from the gas station if open. There is also a (as of july 2023) unlocked dumpster in the back of it, so you could probably find there as well.
Good spot with nice people on tank station that give me marker and cardboard.
Good spot easy to get out of Vienna, easy to get from here to Brno, i even get straight ride to Prague

When I was going from CZ to Vienna, I always wondered what this spot is like. Yesterday I finally stopped here on the way to CZ and here's my comment: I was standing at the roundabout and was surprised that more cars are going towards Vienna than CZ/Poland. Anyway after 30 mins a guy strangely stopped in the middle of the roundabout to check something and when I showed him my CZ sign he took me. I think it is worth stopping here when going from CZ somewhere faraway from Vienna. There were lots o

Directions: Bron, Prague, Poland
A big petrol station with McDonald's. The best spot to leave Vienna in all north directions. Hike from a little roundabout there.
Great to go to Vienna but no one was going anywhere else, a lot of taxi/uber aiport drivers as well. We tried different spots around the airport and non of them worked
Got a lift to Sopron after asking an Hungarian old man. Better chances to go to Hungary than in the Gas Station at Vienna East
excellent spot if youre headed to bratislava, just make a sign and look for cars with slovak license plates, third car that passed by took us straight to the city centre

I was looking for a good spot for a while. But this is one of the best. You need a little bit of luck, but cars are going out of the villa and parking 🅿️ pretty slowly and can stop there quite easily. After I made a sign it took me about 8 min to get a ride to Brno (CZ).

We had a sign to Salzburg and there is a lot of traffic, but most people are going to Villach or Spittal. We got a ride to a gas station on the highway after 40 minutes and had a better chance there. We were 2 men.
Its a really nice spot, still had to wait 2hours to get to highway direction Salzburg.
This is a bus station. Big trees above your head as the shelter from the sun. And bus stop when it is raining. Dirr. Salzburg.

Waited only like 10 Minutes with a sign to Villach and found someone, who took me to Ljubljana. I think asking around here works good as well, because there are a lot of cars. Easy to reach from Salzburg by foot and Bus.

1,2 and 3 guys, weekdays, direction Wien, Linz

This seems to be very good place, but only if you are heading south, not many cars are going north. We had to spend night there and then hitchike for next three hours to get a ride at least in A1 directin. We were three, then two, but I only managed to get ride when I was alone, cars were usually completely full and all trucks were heading south.
We waited 10 minutes but we got many reactions of drivers who just didn't drive far enough for us.
Not very legal but everyone leaving has to pass you, so there's tons of traffic. There's a small spot where the car can stop to let you in before returning to the A1.
Nice people and a great spot but we started at 13 oclock (too late for fast hitchhiking
We  were here pretty at around 17:00 on a Friday. We tried for an hour to get towards Italy but no luck. We ended up staying in Innsbruck. If you have the time it is properly a good spot.

Best spot in Innsbruck. Although If you are going towards Swiss border/Bregenz it's way better to catch a direct car. I made a mistake of accepting the ride to Mils Gas Station where I got stuck for 3h

great spot, good visibility, loads of traffic heading out the city in most directions. avoid taking shorter distance lifts from here as it can be hard to hitchhike through Tirol villages. we took a lift to imst but you could probably get a ride as far as bludenz if yr patient or start early enough.
A lot oft cars and a gas Station but the cars can go in every direction
Great Spot to hitch a ride towards munich, Switzerland or Innsbruck. I managed to get a ride quite deep into Italy :)

People stop here to buy a Vignette for Austria
Easy to ask people directly
Passed through here already in a car, and didn't see any controls. They told me they only look for the vignette some times so there are not always slow or stopping cars.
Just after the police controls is maybe not the better place, but it works, so...
good for going south, many drivers buy the austrian vignette here
Very good spot, many people going so SLO, the nicest truck driver was going to Ljubljana and I took the ride to Maribor (Had a Maribor Zagreb sign)
Good spot going south
We were two guys, nice spot, but less traffic with a lot of families heading to vacation. Luckily we managed to hitchhike to Poreč. There are toilets and gas station nearby.

Decent place
Not much traffic.
Got dropped here by a local, so I would say probably one of the best places to get a ride towards Slovenia - Croatia.
A guy noticed our sing and we managed to get with him all the way to Zagreb.

when I got here in the afternoon I had absolutely no issues getting a ride to slovenia. if there is someone going to Maribor, try to get dropped off at the border rest stop on the slovenian side. People have to stop there to buy a highway pass. lots of cars going to serbia and bosnia
We were 2 guys. Cars have to slow down and see you. We were there in the afternoon in summer and there were a good amount of cars coming. Feels like a good place to get out of Vienna.
Not sure about this spot, but we (2 people) catched a ride with a sign with woman going on vacation to croatia. Guess you have to be lucky here
I was lucky, after 5 minutes took me car to Graz
most people go to vienna but we got a lift to a rest station on the A2, pretty good spot to get out of vienna
Good spot, stand on the left side of the road so cars see you better. I got a ride to Wiener Neustadt in 10 minutes.
A lot of cars, but mostly rich people or locals, still a very nice guy with two small children took me
Got a ride towards the south (A10) relatively easily.

It's a busy station but somewhy for us it was hard to get a lift to Germany. I think one reason can be that the sign of the motorway exit to this station is together with the Salzburg exit so many drivers going to Germany think that from this station they can't get back to the highway so they don't stop. Other possible reason: Saturday. 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), 1h50m

Two guys waited 2.5 hours to get a lift. We were hitchhiking and often asking drivers around, but most of them were not going to Germany. In the end a guy brought us to the border. But all in all, it's a good spot and I think we were a little bit unlucky. Second time I think we would wait at most 90 mins :)

Oct 15: Direction Munich good place. Further its difficult.
But dont wait to long if u want to get further. Get a car towards Munich and get droopped of at Gas station "Holzkirchen" which is the last before Munich.
The second couple we asked took us straight to Vienna.
Lots of traffic in morning so maybe was just unlucky.

I found a very good ride to the south of Vienna but it took me almost 3 hours... Many people go in the directions of Salzburg or Graz, and many also just don't want to help...
Good spot to spend the night though, if you walk out of the station you have houses closeby where you can ask to be hosted (the first one on the left opened their wood storage for me and I slept on the floor), or the beach where I was told you can put up your tent.
Easy to get a ride to Linz "Ansfelden"

1 guy, weekday

Very great place if are you going to Linz or Wien. I managed to get ride to "Ansfelden" gas station in 5 minutes with "W" sign.

Huge gas station with a lot of traffic.
This spot is great since most cars pass through you

Another attempt with a Villach/Slovenia sign, on a weekday, not many vans. First day waited 2 hours with no luck, second day was just about to give up when a Serbian guy (going to Serbia) took me. Be patient. There is a supermarket in the village 3 km north, u can use the tunnel to get to the other side of highway and there is a small road that goes to the village. When u get at Bundesstrasse, on your right, just where the forest ends and farm houses bedin, there is a very nice hunters tower whe
Waited for 45min but then a guy from Munich stopped and took us all the way down to Graz.
waited for 30min with just sign at the exit, got approsched by a very nice man and his campervan, took me all the way to slovenia
Stayed there with Villach/Slovenia sign, good płace with a lot of traffic. German couple with camper to save the day
2 of us were hitching a ride in the evening, not really busy, but pushed by a couple of kilometers by a guy coming from the village.

I think good spot, we (couple) had a sign "passau" and we got a lift to austrian-german border in ten minutes. we were standning at the vary end of the gas station so that aslo cars coming to highway from ansfelde could see us and stop
God knows why, but this place is still a pain in my ass... :]
Good spot
I wanted to go to Passau from here, which wasn't that easy - but I got offered so many lifts to Salzburg, almost every 20-30 Minutes at least someone stopped.
Hitchhiking at night, the best spot with lights. Also good to ask around. At day I'm sure it would go much faster to Vienna
Spoke to a few people in front of the gas station, the 5th or 6th person took me to vienna

Spent a night here trying to get to Klagenfurt. 

Might be better during the day, impossible at night.
We've been hitchiking to Italy for 3 hours from 17:00 with no luck, so we slept in tent in the near woods. Next morning we got a ride in about an hour.
Very good if you're alone, lots of truck drivers here. We slept in the toilet building on the truck parking, it's perfect :)

Impossible to go to Budapest from here. Waited for 1 hr, and walked 5 km to the end of Fishamend, from where easily got to Budapest with 2 rides and 20 min total waiting time. Highly recommend doing the same and not wasting time near airport
Good place to stand, cars are going slow, they can stop safely
Got a ride to Vienna fairly quickly and there is a place to stop.
Perfect spot, we got ride to Bratislava after a few minutes
Not many cars going towards Bratislava but eventually got a lift
In the evening petrol station was empty, only local cars there. It looks like a good spot, but somehow I decided to go to the next spot and there I got a ride in 20 minutes
Just went to the gas station. We (2 guys) didn’t even have to take our sign out, we got a ride to Munich with the 3rd car we asked. I guess quite lucky, but the spot looks really good anyways.
I think you still need to get further away from the city. I was solo, with sign. My first hitch-hike ever, so maybe I was not very confident while asking for a ride, idk :)

Probably a good spot to get a ride to the OMW station, but the part of the highway towards the OMW was temporarily closed, so no lifts there. We opted to walk 10 mins further and stand with a sign. Worked well.
waited 15 minutes for a ride to Linz @ McDonalds
We were 2 guys and got a lift to Maribor. Tried to ask around but people were quite cold. When we signed instead it went fast

We took a train ride from Graz as we didn’t feel like hitchhiking from the city. There is a plenty of space in surrounding area to camp as well. We got to this petrol station around 10am. There was already a lot of traffic mostly fully packed family cars. We cold approached drivers and got a ride all the way to Zagreb.
Asked around at night on a sunday and got a ride within 10min to Maribor. Lot of people
amazing spot for us, went around asking people for a ride and got a hitch all the way to Zagreb

Got our ride after about 20min
Had to ask the car and truck drivers directly.
It wasn't good traffic in the morning, I saw literally only one delivery van on parking on polish plates. I asked him and he gave me a ride directly to Katowice, could be Kraków if I would want.

The only question is which service station is best out of three to continue towards Vienna, Linz/Salburg or Ljubljana or Zagreb. Service station Gralla in Austria, the Slovenian station 1 km south of the border or the Slovenian station north of Maribor on the A1... that truly is the only question... who wants to test them all ten times in both directions? ;) 

(and then, once we find out, and all five zillion hitch-hikers know about it, which will then automatically make the best service station
good for long distances. got a direct lift to Frankfurt ;-)
okay for graz/vienna

Very easy to get to this point with a bus. There was some trafic, most people are stopping for the restrooms. We had trouble finding people with space in their cars. After 80 minutes a couple took us to next gas station further down the road

Get the Bus to Glanegg and Walk 10 Minutes to the Spot. You Need to Climb a fence to get there. But then you are Directly on the Highway. It is Not a big parking Slot, but we fastly found a friendly Truck driver to Slowenia.
Easy to get there, but not the best HH spot. You can ask people around

This is a great spot to go towards the balkans. It can be reached from Salzburg via Bus easily and you can sleep nearby. I think there is a fence but it has holes.
All cars stopping there are going to the balkans especially during holiday season. Many full but I used this spot 2 times and it was always great!
Waited for 2 hours 30 minutes with board with name Bregenz and second one with Liechtenstein. Hardly caught a car to Bregenz. Just in front of the bus stop.

waited 30 minutes for a car in the direction of Bregenz 
 good spot a few metres in front of the bus stop
A nice place to find a car to Bregenz. Here all cars go direction Bregenz
Got ride in less than 10 minutes from a local who offered to take me to what he thought was a better spot, which indeed it was (see map)
With PRA, PRG, PRAHA sign you are almost there from this spot.

Good for Innsbruck but not great for heading west. Eventually got a ride to the next gas station.
Otherwise a perfect hh spot.
Got droped off here and it appeared to be a good spot as I got a lift to Innsbruck in less than 5 minutes.
Direction Innsbruck. It was late afternoon/evening and the traffic seemed to be light but we were lucky to be picked-up in 5 minutes or so.
This is a large Parking lot (German: Parkplatz) and Circle trafficn (German: Kreisverkehr). You can hitch to Innsbruck in the west or to Kufstein in the east direction. Good luck!

Very difficult place to go south. Traffic is either local or towards Freistadt/CZ, with people reluctant to picking you up.

I was standing for over 2 hours in the pouring rain, going back and forth to the gas stations and shops, and after being cold and soaked, a young woman finally took me all the way to Salzburg.

Not a lucky spot! Consider taking a ride that will get you at least to A1 if you wanna go south.

Really luxury place for HH in the direction of Freistadt and the Czech Republic. 
It's located about 1 km after the contemporary (2009) end of the highway A7 towards the border with the Czech Rep.
Very good place. We are a couple and we didn't even waited to get a ride to Villach (with a panel).
Were lucky and stopped a minibus after 10 minutes.
It may be a good idea to wait at the lights for the cars to stop here.
Not the most crowded reststation but we got a ride to Ljublijana in 10 minutes by asking around people in the gas station.

A bit of traffic there, people are a bit hesitant to pick up, but we went front of the entrance to the raststatte and got picked up 5 min after it, cause there was enough space for people to see us and stop

most of the cars going direction north, happily some of the few cars going south stopped, a certain rule about hitchhiking once again proved: you only need one helpful person
could be worth taking a train more up north to a place where you are direct on the main road and get more cars

Great spot to get on the highway either north or south. We walked here from Lermoos train station which is close by. There is a good patch of grass near the gas station to stand on, and cars aren’t going very fast through the village. We waited 5 minutes and got a ride all the way to our campground in Imst. If you have bad luck there are buses that go south to Imst as well.

loads of traffic for switzerland, a lot of people cross the border for work so getting here early you catch commuter traffic to st gallen etc. also a few swiss cars driving by with sg plates, bathroom at the petrol station right behind to refill water and bins filled with cardboard for all your sign making needs :-)

This whole line of grass should be fairly good, as people can stop at the gas station. We chose to stand quite far up in the shade of a single tree, but on less scorching days, standing closer to gas station is probably better, so you don't have to run back to talk to driver. Got a ride in about 30 minutes to Konstanz.
We were really lucky because our previous ride asked around and immediately found another ride for us that took us directly to vienna
Asked around and got picked quickly by Hungarian lady. Amazing spot being in the city center

Asked around at the gas station. Many lovely people willing to take you somewhere but not many going to Bratislava or Budapest. Waited 15min and got a ride to the next gas station which I recommend more.
I think this is relatively good spot, heading to Vaduz.. I didn't stop anyone since it was already getting dark, so I used the bus (it's expensive 😬 and in CHF)
it costs 5 euro to get from any place in wien to wolkersdorf. I stop a car to czechia on the road from wolkersdorf to highway before reaching the gas station. but that was just a luck I guess

Direction: Brno, Prague, Poland
Literally after building the Nord Autobahn this is one of the best places to hike out from Vienna. Get in train to Wolkensdorf, and then just hold the sign while walking from train station to this place. It's enough just to get a little lift to the huge petrol station located about 4km from this spot.

It’s a good spot. Train station is close if you get stuck. Not too much traffic and the guy that took me Said it’s normally not the best spot to go to Graz. But still I got there and waited 5 min- maybe luck.

It’s a good spot because you can check the signs of people at the gas station and ask trucks but also the cars on the streets see you good enough and have the opportunity to stop at the gas station for you and have a conversation. But still I waited a Little Bit longer than usually- allot of locals from Villach. But just be patient and then i got a ride to Klagenfurt. Good luck ;)

There was border control by austrian police, so I came by foot and hitchhiked after it. In first second the police wasn't happy about me crossing border on foot on a highway. After some talk it was okay for them that I would stay on small parking on the right side. It took 10min to catch a ride to next Shell station.
Not many cars, but all go to vienna
It doesnt seem like it but its a good spot, best for Vienna direction
Classical gas station, good for going further south
Basic resting station, quite possible to get a long ride until budapest or further since most of the traffic east is on the road

Basic station, traffic quite good
We were lucky tough
Basic resting station with not that much traffic, asking around works very well though, since people are quite friendly

For sure it's better than others spots in this area. Just go on the ramp and use pretty good place to hike. There is also a lot of place for the drivers to stop. I tried my best in the heavy rain, I wasn't looking inviting, got the ride to next Raststation.
Not perfect in terms of safety but it is just the best in this area. Only few minutes to take a ride to Wien
Advantage is that in summer a lot of people have free place. I was hitchinking there in august
Probably better to ask around, we stood with a sign, but we cought a quick ride to salzburg even late at night.
Good point to get picked of. After 5 minutes I get picked of in heavy rain.

A good place if you want to go towards Italy, France and Germany or the Czech Republic. We were heading towards Budapest and we had some difficulties to find someone who was driving in that direction. But a lot can depend on what time you hitchhiking. On the plus side, a lot of trucks and quite a lot of passenger car traffic at the gas station. A good place to stop/accommodate. There is a shower, laundry, hostel.

Stood with sign Wien for 5 minutes, got taken to Mistelbach. Good spot in the shade, cars have place to stop, low traffic tho, I think we were really lucky
2 guys, backpackers
The gas stations were frequently visited but most people went to Berchtesgarden or Salzburg but we wanted to go to St Johann.
Originally we had a sign for Innsbruck but most of the traffic at the mall is local. After changing it to feldkirch we got a ride pretty quickly.
A lot of locals, but one man saw us and made a uturn to pick us up

Mix of Tourists and locals passing by
Parking lot with tables and benches where you can ask poeple where they are going
Enough place for cars to stop

Two women gave me a lift to Hohetauern
Good starting pint to cross the mountains
Enough place for cars to stop
If you stand on the lane for the bus youll have the best spot in kufstein for munich

We were stuck on a highway gas station near here. Walked here from there and fourtunately got a ride very quickly. We got super lucky obviously. Btw the place has a bit of a shadow for hot summer days.
Not that much traffic but you will find a ride after some time...
Many friendly people, got a short ride to a restspace/petrolstation in the direction Bozen

Good spot, plenty space for cars to stop, but they are going pretty fast. We had sign "Wiena" and after 43mins nice grandma took us. You can get there trough the hole in fence we made, Its almost directly above the bridge. Its little bit tough to get there, but you can manage it somehow, if you have a will
Had Linz on my sign and got told that nobody would go that direction. After 15 minutes we got a ride to St. Pölten. Lots of place to stop and much traffic.
you know the drill
Yet another gas station at the snail-trail through random Austrian villages. there is a bus stop a bit further down the road which might be better
Enough place where to stop, but it's just local road so don't expect too much
We were trying to get to the mountains. Firstly we were waiting in the city center, but I don't recommend that.

mostly cars going to vienna(or direction) at the gas station nearby but some traffic going west through the roundabout onto a1, lot of linz licence plates, not a lot of space to pull over but cars are going slow and will pull over there, and is legal to hitch here since it's not on the motorway
A lot of cars going slow, but most of them were packed to the brim

mostly local drivers but still a good number of slovenian plates. even at 7pm we had two cars stop for us, the first going to villach and the second to ljubljana, getting a lift earlier is probably even easier! we talked to drivers at the station for a little bit but we had better luck standing below the streetlight in front of the station with a sign for ljubljana.

Stayed at a campground in North Feldkirch so this spot was easy to get to, there’s also buses in Feldkirch that get you there. This road is good to go south on the E43 since it goes right to the highway junction in Ruggell. We wanted to go west on the 3 towards Lucerne and Interlaken, got a ride past around Sargans to a rest stop around Bilten.
good spot for direction Linz/Vienna
You've got the space to stop, you know if people are going East or West, so it's a good place to hitchhack West

Bus stop
There are few bus, so it's a good place to hitchhack
Lots of people going towards Graz, cars stop and see you from the traffic light
I think i was lucky to get a ride that far but small rides are for sure good from here
Very good spot to get towards Tirol or Zell am See. There's a roof on the bus station so during rain you can stay dry
Good spot! Lots of traffic all day long. A good place to get towards Zell am See or Tirol. The gas station is a good option too for rainy days
The bus station is good for the cars to stop
After the roundabout. Some locals might park there but it still works. Got a short ride to the next village very fast.
Good spot for both directions.
2 males, people from the city very kind took us for a cafe, but people whom was driving to linz wasnt but young man took us didint know what hitchhiking is hahaha

It's not the best spot to pull over, but the best nearby, got a ride very quickly though. Hitchhiking as a couple with a "Schneeberg" sign... There's also a possibility to stand at the traffic lights or at the exit from the highway. Though I wouldn't probably stand at the exit myself since there are many locals heading to the mountains who don't come from the highway.
Very wide turn towards Dengertstrasse, but busses and cars going to the hotels use it as well, the road was there wide and lots of traffic for west direction, got a car within 15 minutes

Direction towards west, I was here under the bridge where I could hitch both, ones going to the highway, as well as ones going on the B171, got a ride within couple minutes, pretty decent spot, but may be a bit uncomfortable when there'd be lots of traffic, (i was here at evening just before sunset)

A local from Vienna drove me here saying it will be a good spot to go to Czechia since many people from CZ work here. And indeed it was true. I wouldn't choose the place myself, that's why 4/5 but it was great in the end.
Was waiting there around 25-35 min and get ride till Worgl ( direction Kufstein )

This seems like a great spot to go south, although probably mostly short distance trips. Not a lot of traffic, but one of the first cars took us. Since we had unsuccessful been trying to get out of Innsbruck from different locations for the last ~2½ hours we were desperate and took the first car, even if it was only for a short trip.
Good visibility, cars are not yet speeding up. Many holiday makers are passing, going to the east
One guy and it took just five minutes to Padova but lot of cars was full or have just one free place could be harder for more than one person to get a car

In the circle, not the best hold place for cars;
direction to innsbruck, salzburg or munich

Great spot to get to Salzburg. After about 10min with a sign (Salz'B), I was picked up in a fancy car owned by a mine manager, a real character with some wild stories. Crossing the road to this spot is fun, there is an abandon pedestrian tunnel you can go through if you're brave!

Ok spot to go towards graz or Salzburg. You can stand next to the SOS phone on the highway entry. Several police cars saw me and they didn't seem to have a problem with me hitchiking there. Not a lot of traffic tho
not a lot of traffic, but almost all of the cars that pass are driving out of the valley
Bus stop, big traffic. Good for ride to Switzerland.
Quite good spot for direction Rottenmann. I took ride to gas station next to highway to Salzburg.
Lot of space for cars to stop and quite big traffic.
Good bus stop but not so much traffic. You have to be quite lucky. I took ride to Zeltweg.
Bus stop after roundabout, cars go slow. I waited with sign 30 minutes to get ride to Graz. Without sign can it be more hard.
Lots of traffic, nice spot to get in Italy.
There is a place to stop at the bus stop.
Decent spot for Innsbruck direction but not for Germany. Bus stop after the roundabout.

Good spot to at least get to a rastation. You get traffic from two main roads and you also have a gas station.
Pick people with foreign license plates or from other places in Austria. BN, W, BL and MD will hardly pick you up
hhiking out of vienna is a bit of a pain, but it should be okay here. cars can pull up behind you at the bus station
We got a ride to Villach
We got a ride to the Wörthersee from here.
Got a ride to the gas station in Ansfelden
Waited for 90min without a sign (single man), got a ride to Bad fischau rest station from where it was easy to continue towards Graz.
We have a sign with "Graz" and we stay here maybe 20mins. I think the best spot in Vienna to this direction

If you wait behind the traffic light (near the bus stop) most people won't see you, maybe only like the first two or three rows of cars waiting in front of the traffic light (all behind that are going to fast). After some time we moved to to the other side of the crossroad and walked on the grass parralel to the cars stoped on the traffic lifgt. This worked and we, two guys with a sign to Wiener Neustadt, were moved there. The man who was driving us said this spot is only good around 4pm when mo
Tried for one hour without sign, then got a sign from the gas station. Still took another hour, maybe because it was raining the entire time.
2 guys, catched a ride to a gas station on a highway near Wiener Neustadt
Difficult to get a ride to Budapest. Probably best to look for Slovak plates and get a ride to “ASFINAG Raststation Göttlesbrunn”. There you’ll see more Hungarian plates.
Really difficult place to go to Hungary, there is like 95% of locals and 5% that goes to Bratislava (we could go there 2 times). We took just a lift to the airport and see what happens.
Good spot for exiting vieanna, still quite reachable by public transport (one sbahn and a bus) and most of the traffic goes east
Just ask people for a ride, it's not that hard to find a ride to Gyor or Budapest

We were heading towards Budapest but few people were going towards Hungary. More people are heading to a nearby airport. So we caught a ride to the airport and from there we will try to catch a hitchhiking to Budapest.
Not so busy. Mostly trucks. Worth the wait though. Got a ride in a truck to Frankfurt.

This spot is very good, but rather than just waiting with a sign you should go up to people in the big parking spot, which worked for us. We were there at almost 8 pm so not too many cars stoped there. You should also notice that the Zoll Station is directly behind this spot. I can really recommend this spot.
Wednesday 15:00, not so many cars actually. Me and my friend (two guys) waited here onlyabout 25 mins, but we were quite lucky.
Very good spot for hitchhiking to Germany. Heaps of cars stop here to rest and fill a tank. I got ride to Munich after 1,5 hour waiting.
Waited for 4 hours in august 2014. My longest wait so far, but it also got me my longest ride: straight to Amersfoort (NL). Left me with very mixed feelings.
If you go towards Vienna its gonna work for you, direction to Czechia will take a lot of time. Be careful to dont stand in the highway part, police sent us a bit back.
lots of traffic, got ride to wien with sign and thumbing. good shaded patch of grass to for when you need a break.
We struggled to get a ride towards Vienna, we tried asking drivers, even in the McD parking lot. In the end we had luck by just standing in the exit with a sign.
waited there like five minutes with the sign "vienna" and than got a lift

b&g saturday 1 PM

FUCK! Waiting 5 hours in Czech direction. Full cars with families getting back from the vacation. Thanks guys from Gutalax (czech music band) that pickin up us to Černá v Pošumaví and helped with train plan to České Budějovice

I was standing on the ramp from roundabout to direction wien. I had a sign "CZ" hopeing that somebody bypassing wien and going to czechia would take me. but two hours nobady stopped me, there was just a few cars with czech car number. so than I changed my sign to "wien" and got a lift in 20 minutes

After scouting all the spots in this area this one in my oppinion is the best one as you have a chance to stop the regular traffic coming from the ring and the truck drivers coming from the parking lot. They also have time to scan you before they make their decision. This spot also gives the best feeling.

Though this roundabout is the only place where all the traffic is passing through it is not very convenient for stopping and the on ramps have no space for it.
Preferred the car petrol station to be able to talk to people and after 2 hours, took any lift taking me out of there. Considering the size of the place, not so big traffic that day
stay at the roundabout if you don't want to ask. great spot.

You can get a ride both direction on A1 (Linz and Wien, too). The best place to hitchhike is right there where I put the little circle (maybe because I was hunting for Hungarian truck drivers). Anyway, it's better have a sign! :]
Lots of cars even at night. It took us around 30 minutes. Very good spot
It's difficult to come here with public transportation. I walked from car to car asking the drivers if they would take me.

It is a gas station for both ways, Viena or Brno, but the majority of drivers that stops there are comming TO the Czechlands. So if you are here and wanna go the other direction, just find a car to Vienna (asking) first.
Average place for hitchhiking to the Czech republic ...

Great spot but use a sign. Plenty of traffic and a good spot for the cars to pull over. I was trying to go to Lienz so it took me a while to find a ride, but it should be faster to Salzburg or even back to Villach.
got picked up by locals who brought us to lienz. offered us weed and bought us drinks,  it was glorious. best place towards osttirol imo
On B98 300m to Seeboden there is a place for cars to stop, 10 min waiting to salzburg, around 12:00am, 2 people

On-ramp near Spittal, close to the motorway junction. Mainly good for direction Lienz or Salzburg. A few meters down from the crossing there's a shoulder where cars can stop. Speed is a bit high though.
Stood there for hours in the rain till my sign disintegrated. I then just used thumb and got a ride after half an hour. I tried to go to vienna. Maybe better in good weather.
a good spot towards Graz/Vienna. I was here about 50 mins and then a guy took me to Graz. I dont think there is a better spot in KL.
One hour of waiting, dancing, singing - and we got a ride to Vienna (basically, to Graz only)! There's a space for cars to park, but they just didn't stop...then one kind man picked us up :)

Good for getting a ride east - I waited 15 minutes, and got a ride to the mountains near Maribor.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Klagenfurt
Good spots for cars to go east to bludinz or Innsbruck.

I waited 10 mins and was taken by a tesla 😎
But i don't liké the place 'cause people are waiting the bus there

Good spot for Innsbruck although most cars are local. I found a ride to a gas station on the way to the Arlberg tunnel in 40 minutes. Stand on the road at the beginning of the bus stop area to have a better visibility.
To Innsbruck, waited ~40 minutes , it's a bus stop so cars have place to stop, there were a lot of car passing so 40 minutes is not that good but it's possible.
Good spot for Innsbruck but not for Germany. Few cars stopped but were heading towards Innsbruck so I ended switching spots after waiting an hour here.
Terrible, he were here for more than 3h. I was starting to loose all faith in humanity. If you need to stop in Salzburg, tell your ride to drop you somewhere else
Really not that much place to stop for drivers, since some of them are already quite fast. Traffic is good though and we got lucky in a sane amount of time
Waited 10 min for a ride to Linz. Thanks Alma and Emina. Use a sign it's better
good spot to hitch a ride to linz/wien. mcdonald’s next door. better than trying to get to the ENI station down on A1 m, there’s no back road to it
Waited a bit in the evening, slept near the street on the rim of the field. Next morning got a ride towards vienna.
Hitched in front of the busstation. Friendly guy to munchen picked me up after approx 1h. Use of sign highly recommended
Thumbed right before the bus station.

Literally a thousand cars passed me without even giving me a look. (Tuesday afternoon). 
Worst spot.
I stand near the jewelery with a sign "LIN" and car to Linz stopped in five or ten minutes. It was Monday 3pm.
Got a ride to Linz in 20 mins with a Linz sign (final destination Vienna).

I tried to Graz. After 5 hours I gave up. 
I asked many people's and also hittchike but simply- 99% cars go to Salzburg/Innsbruck/Passau.

Don´t start too early in the morning. We did and there was not too much traffic. After unsuccessfully trying to hitch the country road we came back split up and found a lift for each of us pretty quickly.
Sometimes there is not as much traffic but we talked to everyone who stopped there and eventually it worked after 1 hour. Talking worked, the sign did not

be brave! talk to drivers!! you won't have much luck standing at the exit of the carpark (is what we think anyways), cars going west and north to salzburg passau germany etc, a bunch of czech plates and lovely motorcyclists
Not so many cars stop at the gas station as expected and if you go further in the direction of a highway there is little room for a car to stop. So better stick to the gas station.
got lucky and someone asked us whether we want a ride within few mins, otherwise might be harder to get out of
Started at 9am with Linz sign. Lot of traffic, but we waited for more than an hour to get to St Valentin exit.
Big rest area and depending on the time of day a good spot. Got a ride to Linz after less than 1h

Hit or miss
Friday 16:00 absolutely zero chance despite holding a sign with direction Innsbruck. Got shouted and honked at. Try this spot rather on a weekend.
Great spot, good visibility, slow and steady traffic, friendly drivers.
Quite a lot of traffic, but not exclusivly for the Highway. Used a sign with Slov./ Maribor and after 50min someone took us to Maribor but not along the Highway but over Motorways.
There is McDonald, people are stopping by from the highway. You can try to ask people, but after 10 min someone offered us a hitchhike to the border.

not so bad, kind of a game of chance with the traffic lights. waited here with a sign that said salzburg / linz and finally a guy picked me up and drive me just to the closest gas station on the a9 where i then caught a ride with a truck to wels. not the worst, not the best. was thinking of trying the gas station about a kilometer closer to graz, could be better there to ask around.

Next to the Shopping Nord on Wiener Straße, I waited just after the bridge. I held a sign with "München", and in 20 minutes I got a ride close to Linz. A lot of traffic in the direction Linz/Salzburg.

On a Saturday afternoon, this gas station was rather empty. Weekend travellers are mostly families taking long breaks, so you might find yourself standing for quite a while. 
Cars towards Linz, Salzburg, Germany and Belgium.

Consider taking a car that takes you to a bigger raststation such as St. Pölten.
We just got out of one car and gathered our luggage, showed sign and a truck stopped to us :). We were lucky, probably :).
Nice, but a bit empty gas station, in direction to Linz/Salzburg/Germany. Got lift after half an hour.

I is look good place...worsest experience in life, 3days,no sense at all to get to the highway direction to Vienna 
Better never go to Graz, stay in highway only !

A local recomended this spot towards slovenia, croatia and italy. Its a tram stop so there is a place to sit. If you stand before The crosswalk people can easily see you and stop at the bus stop behind. We have wanted for maybe 20 min with sign slovenia ( around 17:00 on thuesday) and a very nice lady picked us up and took to Maribor. Seems like a lot of people go this way from graz to Maribor.
not the best spot, but its the only option to get out of graz, we got a lift to the rest station behind graz

We were 2 people (a girl and a boy) on our way to Slovenia. We spent the whole day trying to get out of Graz, it was hell, this city really is evil. After hitchiking for like 3 hours from the other bus station (Karl-Huber-gasse), we decided to go to this one (Dr.-Lister-gasse) a Slovenian guy stopped. There is a lot of space for cars to stop in the bus lane and it is probably the only convenient spot to leave Graz towards south. Good luck!
We had a sign towards SLO.
Best spot in Graz in Italy/Klagenfurt direction. One hour of waiting
Feels like traffics goes too fast and is too crowded for people to stop. We were 2 and didnt get a hitch. People dont look at you.

We (2 guys) Waited for 8 hours and got no ride, although 1 car stopped which wasnt going our direction(Graz). Seems like a good place with cover from rain in form of the bridge and streetlights, maybe we were just unlucky

its best to stand a little bit further away from the on ramp just behind the first overhead bridge where theres a small space on the shoulder for a driver to pull in. mostly local cars but also a few Graz plates. people driving by were a bit stern but if you smile and wave theyll act a bit more friendly and you might convince someone to pull in who wouldnt have otherwise.
generally ok, the problem is the viennese people who seem to be very adverse to hitchhiking, not the spot
Good enough spot to get south, many locals drive not that far but it's worth getting for example to a rest station near Wiener Neustadt where you'll meet more long-distance drivers

Almost perfect hitchhiking spot. On a Wednesday noon, it was a bit empty but quickly I found a ride to Vienna!

I suggest to stop or ask at the gas station rather than the restsurant, because it's rather wealthy people who go eat there and families.

It's easy for both directions to hh
I got out from one car and immediately found a driver directly to Vienna.
A gas station that accepts traffic from both highway directions. For this reason this is probably a bad hitchhiking spot.
This is in theory an ok spot but it's already on the onramp and a bit scary to reach. After about 45min on a Saturday afternoon cops came and told me off so I had to leave unsuccessful.
July 2019, direction Villach. Lots of traffic but not much heading to the west towards Germany I guess on a Thursday afternoon. Waited for 45 mins until someone took me to Villach

Direction South (Villach) or West (Munich).

Before the tunnel entrance there is a perfectly visible, very good place for cars to stop. Use a sign!
only a few PL/H/CZ cars passed and everyone ignored me. this roundabout is not a truly convenient place for drivers to stop, I would personally stay at the separate lane a bit earlier.

Took the bus to G3 mall and made use of the free toilet (No free toilet at main train station), walked 20 minutes to this spot and someone picked me up after standing there for 5 seconds. Had a sign saying "10 km", and was driven to the good gas station spot 10 km from here. Direction Czech!
Got a Ride to Garda lake within an hour

Two guys hitchhiking south to Italy. Most cars stop to eat or get fuel, but many are cars already full (travellers heading south or north. It took (probably more than) 2 hours to get a lift and we had been running around asking people and used a sign. In the end we got lucky though, but most travellers were already full cars (although they were mostly long-distance-travellers).
Slow traffic and perfect for people to pull over. Decent if you want to go to Innsbruck. Our man took us halfway. People are kind and gesture a lot.

I didn't find traffic going far south. It seems Germans prefer to enter the highway on the first roundabout in Kufstein.

Got a ride to the gas station near this first roundabout after more than half an hour.

I was thumbing and using a sign saying "Italia".

Some people passing through but must just going to McDonnald's and back home. I would also say there is more traffic to Graz than to Wien, but hard to say if it will remain like this, because the road is under reconstruction. We, two guys with a sign to Wien, got there after 90 or so minutes.
There is not much traffic. People stop at McDonald's. After 30 minutes, we get a ride to Bruck.
Very few cars. Long wait.
Not many cars stop there but I found a direct ride to Innsbruck after 40 minutes.
pretty good station, lots of cz plates, not too much traffic tho

We waited here for 2 hours (2 other groups of hitchhikers waited for similar time) and didn’t get a ride so we changed the spot to one closer roundabout, definitely better.
A lot better of cars going to Poland and Czech Republic, but drivers not always so eager to take hitchhikers.
we declined 4 cars going to vienna and found a ride to maribor
The only way how to get out of Graz. Two girls took us to Klagenfurt.
Lots of cars passing by. Most of them go to the local shopping center though. Trying to reach Italy, eventually got picked up to Arnoldstein near the borders.
Bus station, 30 minutes with sign "ITALY"
it’s ok to get to the first petrol station on the highway. from there you can easily find a ride to prague!

Not the best spot, only few cars stop here. Sunday late afternoon it was almost empty.

Since it's a small gas station it's still easy to ask drivers at least and they're mostly very kind.
Not very busy (late afternoon, sunny day).
only waited 3 minutes and got picked up by some very friendly south tyroleans who drove me to bruneck/brunico.
Two guys hitchhiking south to Italy. A lot of local traffic, but we got a lift to a reststop further down the road all the same.

I got here from Innsbruck with the tram (STB), and waited about a hour to get a ride to Gries (I was standing here with a sign IT). There are going a lot of domestic people, but I think it is a good spot.
Was lucky, the first truck driver i asked took me to Bolzano.
This spot can be reached in bus from the city.
This spot really sucks. If you wanna get out of Graz (besides maybe not going there at all lol) you have to go to the bus station that's situated like 300 metres before this one (Dr-lister-Gasse).
This spot just sucks, the chance that a car will stop is much lower than on the stop before - Dr Lister Gasse. It's senseless to hitchhike here when 300 m before is a great spot!

This spot here isnt accurately placed, since there are no roads where it is located. The correct one is the one at the bus stop, which I thought it is a good spot to go to Vienna, but it took me 1h40m to leave the spot on a sunday 6p.m.. The "after traffic lights" discussion is outdated, because it is not possible to wait there properly and to increase chances, I suppose.
Thought it is a good spot to go to Vienna, but it took me 1h40m to leave this spot on a sunday 6p.m.

Good place, used it for to go to Maribor and later to Zagreb. Once you get on the A9... Had to wait 45 min, but was a holiday, and about 30 min. Had a sign for the first, but a sign with A9 on it is better I think
Direction Linz- I waited a lot, at the end gave up. Mostly local traffic
A local said to us that it’s a best spot to leave Graz direction Vienna. Mostly people leave from the other side. But we had probably luck. Got a ride directly to Vienna- Patience is the key;)

Waited with a sign (--> A9) and were dropped at the next gas station on the A9 highway (near Deutschfeistritz) - not much traffic there, but we eventually made it back home to Berlin that very day. (:
Waited with a sign about 2 hours. A truck stopped and took me to Germany.

Onto A9, direction north
You can stand with a sign and ask petrol station customers simultaneously.
Look for SK license plate, and stir them in there eyes.
We were so lucky, less than one minute standing here, a guy stopped and took us to Bratislava!
Wasnt even thumbing or signing, dude came up to me asking if i wanted a ridw

I tried for a while to get to Budapest with a sign but there weren’t many Hungary plate cars (although two separate drivers thought I wanted to buy a taxi to there.) After that I resigned myself to stop off at Bratislava. I tried a few spots, but in the end that one worked in about 10 minutes. About 50 metres down the pavement from the bills. I think it is not too difficult to hitch to Slovakia from here but I would NOT recommend for Budapest.
Asked around for a bit, but not that busy. With a sign we got a ride at the fourth car after roughly 10 minutes of waiting

We first waited where the marker is set but it was not too much going on and decided to ask the people directly if they have some space for us to get to Salzburg or Munich. After asking 3 cars we got a direct ride to Munich. We were 2 men.
Waited 30 ministra to get ride to Salzburg.
Mostly families or full cars, many going north. Found a couple who took us directly to Ljubljana (weekday, 10am, mid of august)

I noticed the marker on the map is on the ramp to the highway. This is not the best spot since cars dont have a very safe place to pull over. The best is always to go talk to the persons as they are tanking. Otherwise, you can also show your sign at the entrance of the station.

We didn't even started trying to stop cars and a guy asked if we wanna go further on the highway, we ended up on OMW near Wiener Neustadt. So it was a pretty nice experience, but other reviews are not that good. We was just lucky.
the petrol station further down the road is way better for some reason
Asking people here about 1 hour didn't work for me. I walked to the next spot with my sign  and i got a lift in not time.
I would recomend to use the next gas station further down the street.
asking people works good here most of the times, but somtimes not
Noone took me after more Or less 3 hours. Most of people go to g3 or to center of viena.

Probably the best stop for heading towards Brno from Vienna on Hitchwiki. A lot of cars just going to the G3, and a lot of the cars that stopped are just going local, not much further up the road, but it's a good spot, plenty of visibility, good stopping land, petrol station for convenience.
